intro: Ruellia mysorensis, commonly known as the Mysore ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. Ruellia mysorensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
